intro: Reichardia gaditana, commonly known as the Canary Island dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its flowers are yellow, and it produces a distinctive pappus for seed dispersal. Reichardia gaditana is often found in open habitats and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate.
